title: Thirstiest Celebrity, Quarantine Escape Room 3.23.20
itunes:title: Thirstiest Celebrity, Quarantine Escape Room 3.23.20
description:
In episode 592, Jack and Miles are joined by quarantine bae Jamie Loftus to discuss internet speeds, insider trading by our senators, tax day, Aaron Paul wanting to play Kurt Cobain, Josh Gad crying, great online content to check out, and more!

FOOTNOTES:

  1. COVID-19 impacts on Internet traffic: Seattle, Northern Italy and South Korea
  2. COVID-19 Update: Growth of video during work at home
  3. 2020 Mobile Internet Phenomena - Report Highlights
  4. Netflix, Other Streamers Urged to Degrade Video Quality to Conserve Internet Bandwidth
  5. Coronavirus Lockdown Boosts Interest in Pirate Sites and Services
  6. Four senators sold stocks before coronavirus threat crashed market
  7. Senator Dumped Up to $1.7 Million of Stock After Reassuring Public About Coronavirus Preparedness
  8. Weeks Before Virus Panic, Intelligence Chairman Privately Raised Alarm, Sold Stocks
  9. IRS extends tax deadline to July 15 from April 15
  10. Aaron Paul Is Interested In Playing Kurt Cobain In A Nirvana Biopic
  11. Josh Gad Shares Video of Himself Crying to Let People Know It's OK to be Emotional
  12. Club Penguin Online
  13. Escape your boredom with this at-home escape room made with Google Docs
  14. I wrote a Curb Your Enthusiasm episode about Corona virus.
  15. Collective Care Is Our Best Weapon against COVID-19
  16. Los Angeles AA Online Meeting Directory
  17. WATCH: Zoot Woman- Chicago, Detroit, LA

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
